backpack: Core focus of the write‑up; refers to methods that enable AI systems to align their objectives automatically without extensive human supervision.
The broader field within which auto‑alignment research is situated, aiming to ensure that advanced AI behaves as intended.
A common baseline technique for alignment that the bootcamp likely compares against or builds upon.
The primary class of models on which auto‑alignment methods are tested and demonstrated in the write‑up.
Describes the intensive, hands‑on training structure used to teach and prototype auto‑alignment methods.
Key component for training aligned agents; the bootcamp may explore automated ways to construct reward models.
Techniques that let models generate their own alignment signals, central to the notion of auto‑alignment.
An alignment strategy involving recursive decomposition of tasks, often discussed in auto‑alignment contexts.
Addresses how alignment methods can be applied when human evaluation becomes infeasible at large scales.
Used in the bootcamp to diagnose and understand how auto‑aligned models make decisions.
